ratings.comment: Took this class my freshman year and Rich is still one of favorite professors - 4 years later. Such a great guy - me and my buddy went to visit him at the museum all the time for the next few years.  Class has lots of facts, so don't take it if you're lazy.  Great lecturer - passion, knowledge.  And he loves to work with students.  Take it!!

Prof. Slaughter is one of the best professors I have ever had. He is funny, passionate, and interesting. He interacts well with the students and knows the subject to perfection. To anyone who says this friendly attitude is a front to hide the difficulty of the class is ignorant and clearly did not spend time studying. His exams are hard but fair.
Likeable enough i guess, until you get your final grade. Don't let the "im your best friend" act fool you. The majority of you will get BC's or C's.

By far the best class I've taken at UW. Extremely entertaining. There is a lot to memorize, so if you don't try you won't get an A, but with the lecture notes he gives out it's not bad easy enough. If you are at all interested in paleontology you need to take this class.

Great teacher, really fun. Makes the class very enjoyable. Brought us on a field trip to a quarry to look for fossils, and everybody found a TON!! Great teacher, great class. A must take for any major.

Awesome professor! He is very passionate about what he teaches and that really shows in the class. Very fun to go to lecture. I looked forward to class everyday. And tests are hard, but if you go to lecture and lab, they aren't a problem. All in all, best class that I've had so far.

Rich is a great guy, great lecturer and really engaging. I definitely recommend this class, especially if you want to have some laughs during lecture. But, beware---tests require you to memorize the lecture notes front and back. Focus on learning the timescale (even though he'll tell you not to, but it'll help you on tests!) Study hard!

Dr. Slaughter is an amazing professor!  He is passionate about the topic and enthusiastic about teaching.  His lectures are fascinating to listen to!  The exams are tough and require a lot of studying and memorization, but it is worth it to listen to him during lecture.  He makes an effort to be approachable and helpful.  Rich is a great professor!
Excellent teacher, I highly recommend him. He explains material very well and is interesting to listen to. Also, he makes some material that should be boring fun to hear. Great prof
GREAT Prof.  Awesome class content.  If you work with Rich one on one before an exam, you'll do wonderfully.

He loves what he does and makes you excited about it. We even had an optional fossil dig one weekend! VERY fun. Tests were sometimes tough, but that was balanced out by the lack of assignments or texts. Great class if you're more of a physical science person but you need bio science credits - and no books to pay for!! :)

Excellent class.  Does require a bit of memorization, but it is a 100 level class.  If you attend the lectures, next to no studying is required for the exams.  All of the pictures shown on the exams are seen in class.  He is very animated while lecturing too which makes for an interesting lecture.
Lots of rote memorization and regurgitating anatomical features of million year old fossils--- stay away.

Rich is an excellent professor, who is clearly very passionate about his subject. His lectures are easy to follow, and he explains everything thoroughly, even adding in some funny extras to keep things interesting. Memorization is key, and an A is easy to acheive if you do that well.

I am shocked at the bad reviews of this class. How much easier can a class get than one where the professor gives out a study guide with everything you need to know on it? If you are lazy like some of these reviewers seems to be don't take this class, but if you can study a few hours for a test, take this it!!Awesome guy and intersting material. Not hard at all, you will be glad you took it!

Rich is an outstanding professor. He is always willing to help students and is the most accessible/approachable I've had at UW. Rich's knowledge/passion for geology carries into the lectures, making dull subjects interesting. This class is no cake walk but all the lecture tests come off a 10p. study guide, memorize that and you should be golden.
wow, wish i wouldnt have taken this class ruined my gpa for this semester. it is way to hard for a 100 level class. not the most intelligent person i have ever meet. stay away from this class please!

if you want a hard three credit class, take this.  not good, you learn elementary facts that you just have to give back, sounds easy except when you have 10 pages of terrible info to remember. take something else that is actually easy plays favorites and actually does not know how to say some of the words

One of the best professors I've had here at Madison. He made the subject more fun than I ever imagined it could be. Don't be scared by people who say the tests are too specefic. Study hard the day or two before, go to class, and you'll be fine. It's worth it.

Great lecturer, easily one of the best on campus... I had no interest in Geology before this class. However, like others said, the exams are unruly... nights before the exam, I would not get more than 2 or 3 hours sleep. Plus, there are lab exams... they aren't nearly as hard, but they are not easy, either. Make sure you take notes on everything.

Dr. Slaugher is an excellent professor overall.  He is an extremely entertaining lecturer and loves what he does.  My only complaint is that the class and lab exams are very difficult and require a high amount of memorization.

Anyone who says this class is hard was not going to lecture. Rich was a great lecturer and he gives you all his notes to study from. There's no discussions only a Lab section and its required to go. I cant say I minded coming because the Lab TA Maryruth was nice and damn fine. Take the class. You won't regret it.
Do not take this class unless you are interested in memorizing useless information.  He is a cool guy, but his exams are extremely specific.  I honestly wish I did not take this class.
very very nice guy! The class is very interesting. the exams are not hard and he knows everything about his students! Take his class

What a great guy!  I didn't find him as hilarious as other reviews but the material was pretty interesting.  With no textbook it makes the class a breeze.  Attend lecture just because that's the only way you're even sure you have a class to go to.  Lab is mandatory but lasts about 20 minutes.  Gotta love it.

This class is interesting just because Rich is such a hilarious guy. Come to lectures so you don't miss the funny videos. The notes he hands out really help for preparing for exams. Labs exams are harder than lecture exams because you need to know the material in greater depth. Rich is really helpful if you go see him in office hours.

The lecture notes from Slaughter are you bible. I didn't realize that until it was too late to fix my stupid mistake. So study and memorize those lecture notes and then work on your own notes. The lectures are really fun even at 8:50am but don't try to cram this class into your schedule. The lab is overly hard but still interesting. No textbook :(.

Really nice guy, pretty good class, but not an easy A.  Lecture exams don't reward you for what you know, they punish you for what you don't know. you have to memorize a lot of stuff and then you're not tested on most of it; your test grade can easily drop a whole letter because you forgot a few obscure things, despite knowing everything else.
This is the funniest professor i've ever had.  makes class fun

Epitome of the plug and chug course. The lab leader and the professor are like dualing bandits in expectations of how much you should memorize for the tests. Sure, it's easy if you just memorize everything but the competition between the lab and the lecture is pointless and the emphasis on memorization beyond boring. But awesome lectures! Toss up.

What an awesome professor.  Lectures are great because the material is interesting, plus, he's a really funny guy.  Labs are fun, but TA Erik is kind of a dork.  Be careful for tests.  Make sure you know everything about what is mentioned and you'll be fine.  Would definitely take him again.

This is by far the best and most enjoyable class I ever took at UW.  Rich is a great professor - the class was so much fun that I even brought my dad to a section.  Rich made me love fossils and geology, and I would recommend this class to anyone looking for a fun solution to the science requirement

If you can memorize easily, then this class is for you. This class is basically learning about critters of the past and their obscure names. So it's kind of like learning a different language but easier.
very funny guy, class is easy, lab is a bit hard though, no hw ever, very enjoyable, make u sure u attend class so u dont miss the videos (hilarious)
He makes little videos to go along with his slides and they're hilarious!

Absolutely hilarious at times and young at heart. Knows and loves the material well. Lectures are clear and easy to understand. Very willing to help a student succeed in the class if asked. Lecture exams are pretty easy if you study at least a little, lab exams are NOT (gotta study a lot more them than you do for lecture!). Lots of fun!!

Great guy, good lecturer.  His lectures are concise, clear, interesting, and usually entertaining.  He gives concise notes out before the test too.  The class is fairly easy, but there's a lot of memorization, and if you don't prepare yourself, you'll end up doing badly.

Great professor, my favorite so far.  He's very clear, intelligent, organized and funny.  Loves his material and conveys that to students.  Lectures are interesting and well worth attending.  Extremely willing to help and aid students whenever necessary.

The most entertaining, funny, enjoyable prof I've had at the Univ. I'm not even a science major! I love his lecture formats. Clear presentation of material. Great knowledge of fossils. Really knows the geology museum. All should take Geo 107 b/c he rocks.
